briefTitle: Efficacy and Safety Study of CVT-301 In Parkinson's Disease Patients With OFF Episodes

outcomeMeasures.title: Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale (UPDRS) Part III
outcomeMeasures.description: Primary Efficacy Analysis: Change from Predose in the Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale (UPDRS) Part III Score at 30 Minutes post-dose at Week 12 for CVT-301 High Dose versus Placebo (ITT Population). UPDRS Part III ranges from 0 minimum to 86 maximum, with lower scores indicating better movement. Units on a scale.

outcomeMeasures.title: Proportion of Patients Achieving Resolution of an OFF to an ON State Within 60 Minutes.
outcomeMeasures.description: Examiner-assessed observation - Subject Achieving Resolution of an OFF to and ON state within 60 Minutes at TV4 - Observed

outcomeMeasures.title: UPDRS Part III Motor Score at 20 Minutes
outcomeMeasures.description: Change from Predose in the Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale (UPDRS) Part III Score at 20 Minutes post-dose at Week 12 for CVT-301 High Dose versus Placebo (ITT Population) and CVT 301 Low Dose versus Placebo. UPDRS Part III ranges from 0 minimum to 86 maximum, with lower scores indicating better movement. Units on a scale.

outcomeMeasures.title: Proportion of Subjects Who Improved PGIC With CVT-301 vs. Placebo at Week 12
outcomeMeasures.description: Patient Global impression of change at treatment visit 4 (week 12) by improvement category. Seven point Likert scale ranging from 1= much worse to 7= much better.

outcomeMeasures.title: UPDRS Part III at 10 Min.
outcomeMeasures.description: Change from Predose in the Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale (UPDRS) Part III Score at 10 Minutes post-dose at Week 12 for CVT-301 High Dose versus Placebo (ITT Population). UPDRS Part III ranges from 0 minimum to 86 maximum, with lower scores indicating better movement. Units on a scale.

outcomeMeasures.title: PD Patient Diary
outcomeMeasures.description: Change in total daily OFF times for 3 consecutive days prior to week 12 visit compared to 3 consecutive days prior to baseline visit. Participants recorded On or Off state in 30 minute intervals during waking hours.
